robot.navigation

Class OdometryCorrection

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot.navigation.OdometryCorrection

  • public class OdometryCorrection
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates the current position and heading of the robot whenever it crosses a gridline. Requires both light sensors to cross the gridline before being able to calculate values.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andreas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OdometryCorrection(ColorGather colorGather, double wheelRad, double sensorWidth, double sensorDist)
      In order to correct the position and heading, the OdometryCorrection class must use information gathered from the ColorGather class in order to determine when it has crossed a line.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void update(double[] data, double speed)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • OdometryCorrection

        public OdometryCorrection(ColorGather colorGather,
                  double wheelRad,
                  double sensorWidth,
                  double sensorDist)
        In order to correct the position and heading, the OdometryCorrection class must use information gathered from the ColorGather class in order to determine when it has crossed a line. It also requires constants like the radius of the wheels, the distance between the two sensors and the distance from the sensors to robot's axis of rotation
        Parameters:
        colorGather - - The ColorGather class being used
        wheelRad - - The radius of the wheels (constant)
        sensorWidth - - The distance between the center of the two light sensor (constant)
        sensorDist - - The distance from the two light sensors to the robot's axis of rotation

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(double[] data,
          double speed)
        Provides updated postion and heading data. Updates the 'data' array passed with (if possible to calculate) new data. Allows for the calculation of more accurate values for the robot's position and heading when the robot crosses a gridline. Passes x, y, and theta back to the caller.
        Parameters:
        data - - The array containing current x, y, and theta values. This array will be updated with corrected values if available.
        speed - - Forward unsigned speed of the robot (to be used in calculations)
